Nullification of Formal Signing of Humiliating Agreements Declared
articles.content:
Nullification of Formal Signing of Humiliating Agreements Declared 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea (Phyongthongsa) reportedly sponsored a press conference in front of the building of the "Ministry of Defence" on Oct. 26 to declare the nullification of the formal signing of the agreements on transferring the U.S. military base from Ryongsan and on revising the plan for joint land management as regards the fact that the United States and the south Korean "government" formally signed the agreements on the same day despite the strong opposition of all public circles.
 At the press conference the chief of the U.S. forces issue team of Phyongthongsa, the chief of the policy room of the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society and others declared the agreement on transferring the U.S. military base deceiving the people and absolutely favorable to the U.S. null and void and expressed resentment at the U.S. moves for aggression threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula.    
 During the press conference members of Phyongthongsa staged one-by-one demonstration in protest against the "government" in front of the main gate and the rear gate of the building of the "Ministry of Defence".

articles.title: Foreigners Arrive
articles.content:
Foreigners Arrive 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Nikolaus Scherk, director for Asian and Oceanic Affairs of the Foreign Ministry of Austria, who is a special envoy of the foreign minister, and his party arrived here Saturday.
 Also among the arrivals here on the same day was a friendship delegation of the Jiangsu Provincial People's Government of China led by its Vice-Governor Wang Zhan.

articles.title: Greetings to Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian President 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on October 31 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the start of revolution in Algeria.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop, the message wholeheartedly wished the friendly Algerian people new progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Tunisian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tunisian President 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Zine el Abidine Ben Ali on October 29 on his reelection as president of Tunisia.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would as ever grow stronger and develop, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work for the development of the country.

Greetings to Australian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Australian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to John Howard on his reelection as prime minister of Australia.
 Expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would steadily develop on good terms, the message wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Tok Gyu
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Tok Gyu
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il Saturday sent a wreath to the bier of People's Artist Kim Tok Gyu, chairman of the Sub Committee for Direction and Acting of the C.C. of the Korean Film Workers Union, expressing deep condolences over his death.
